CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert L. Wright, 1533 Oakdene Street,was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 12, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should well defined courses in sex education be taught in public school system? If so, at what grade should the teaching of these courses begin?" answer reads: "I do think that the subject should be taught to children no younger than at the age of 13.  At that age they will know what they are doing.  By teaching them these things it will keep them from the pitfalls of life, because if they go wrong, it's pretty bad."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert L. Wright wearing uniform hat with "W" and reed stripe and jacket with "W" pins on lapels, standing with hands behind back in front of stone wall
